page.title: 02RELIGION MOSQUE CUSTOMS
page.content: Before I go to the mosque I wash my hands and face then put on my scarf and go to the mosque with my sister and brother. When I get there I must take off my shoes. When the children need help they put up their hand and then I go to them and tell them the word they do not know and help them with their alphabet. When I have told some of the children I go and get my Korne and first I have to kiss the Korne three times and then the other girl gets up . When she has read then I take the cover off and begin to read. The Koran has 30 parts to it and it tells you the messages of God. Some times I read about 7 or 8 pages. The mosque is in Westbourne Road Luton and some times classes come from different schools. The mosque starts at 4o'clock for children and ends at 6 o'clock.
